metadata.title: CVE-2019-25045 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.19. The XFRMsubsystem has a use-after-free, related to an xfrm_state_fini panic, akaCID-dbb2483b2a46.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-25045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-66.75').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1048.48').
linux-aws package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1052.54').
